question_content.barrons:question: The author cites Logan, Huggins, and Litwack for their

barrons:choices.barrons:choice: return to the field of Afro-American history
research on blacks in nineteenth-century North Carolina
failure to respond to the changing intellectual milieu

question_content.barrons:explanation:
return to the field of Afro-American history.

The three men are cited as examples of scholars who were encouraged to resume their earlier researches in black history.

Significant work on Jacksonian democracy is incorrect. Only Litwack is identified in the passage as having lectured on Jacksonian democracy.

Participation in the Harlem Renaissance is incorrect. Although Huggins did write a book on the Harlem Renaissance, none of the three men were identified in the passage as having participated in the Harlem Renaissance.

Research on blacks in nineteenth-century North Carolina is incorrect. Only Logan is identified in the passage with research on blacks in nineteenth-century North Carolina.

Failure to respond to the changing intellectual milieu is incorrect. All three men responded to the changing intellectual milieu by becoming specialists in black history.
